abstract: “The Social Network,” the film that paints an unflattering portrayal of Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder and chief executive of Facebook, raises a question: how can filmmakers take liberties with the story of a living person, and does that person have any recourse if the portrayal upsets him?
snippet: “The Social Network,” the film that paints an unflattering portrayal of Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder and chief executive of Facebook, raises a question: how can filmmakers take liberties with the story of a living person, and does that person h...
lead_paragraph: Millions of the moviegoers who made “The Social Network” the top box-office draw of the weekend saw an unflattering portrayal of Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder and chief executive of Facebook.

headline.main: No Stopping Movie View of Mark Zuckerberg
